results.title: After hours
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, Australian Film Commission, Film Australia and Women's Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatized situation of an office worker who alleges sexual abuse when asked to stay back late to finish some typing. She loses her job as a result of her claims. Both her fellow workers and boyfriend fail to understand her situation, somehow blaming her for what happened. The investigator for the case finds difficulty in obtaining evidence from people associated with the manager. Cast: Danielle Pearse, Don Reid, Anna-Maria Monticelli, Russell Newman.

results.title: Out of Control
results.brief_description: Developed in co-operation with the Child and Adolescent Psychiatry Unit of the Prince of Wales Hospital, this video shows how to offer support to young children between the ages of 10-14 years, to say “No” to drugs that may be offered to them. It is suitable for use by parents, community organisations, church groups, counsellors and teachers.

results.title: Women 88
results.brief_description: Women ‘88 is a series of seven five minute films. The series was produced for the Women’s Program Bicentennial Authority and celebrates and promotes the past and present quality of Australian Women’s achievement, so as to inspire pride in, and respect for, their diverse contributions to the evolution of Australian society.

results.title: Sounds Like Australia
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted film that brings you the unique sounds of the Australian bush. It interweaves the songs of our rare birds - The Victorian Rifle, Lyrebird and the Emu among others, with music that celebrates the Australian landscape and its wildlife…the sounds of Australia.

results.title: All that glitters
results.brief_description: In September 1982, forty-five nations of the Commonwealth sent 1,500 athletes to Brisbane for the Twelfth Commonwealth Games. This program focuses on athletes and coaches, highlighting their relationships, lifestyles and training and their individual struggles. This film is the official film of the 12th Commonwealth Games, held in Brisbane, and is a combination of the films featured in the “Striving ” series.

results.title: Rocking the foundations
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
results.brief_description: A film that goes behind the headlines to look at the extraordinary chain of events that has made the New South Wales Builders’ Labourers’ Federation the controversial part of Australian history that it is today. It is a story about workers who began to act for themselves and make decisions about issues that affected ordinary people. Also looks at the new policies that saw women introduced into the building industry, limited tenure of office and the use of union power to assist resident action and environmental groups. Narrated by Pat Fiske. (NOTE: 16mm print is black and white.)

results.title: For love or money: a history of women and work in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeni Thornley, Megan McMurchy, Margot Nash, Margot Oliver and Flashback Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of women’s working lives throughout Australia’s history. Juxtaposes clips from feature films, home movies, newsreels and documentaries with radio shows, diaries, popular songs, letters and interviews. Explores the challenges that face women in the nuclear age. Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst; edited by Margot Nash; music by Elizabeth Drake.
results.title_for_label: For love or money: a history of women and work in Australia
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeni Thornley, Megan McMurchy, Margot Nash, Margot Oliver and Flashback Films

results.title: Having a go: a look at small business in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Cassidy, Tony Coyte, Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with entrepreneurs from five successful small Australian businesses. Each provides advice on how to succeed while stressing the need to be fully informed and equipped with proper business skills. Highlights the importance of government sponsored small business agencies for providing information and training.

results.title: Fiji - legacies of empire
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Philip Robertson, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series looks at the Pacific islands, the traditions associated with them and issues that pose problems to them. This particular film examines the different aspects of life in Fiji. It notes the opinions of a patriarch of the hard-working Indian population and explores the co-existence of Hindus and Moslems who own less than a fifth of the land. Camera by Dennis O’Rourke and Joe Pickering.
